title: Getting Started
text: Let’s expand features table. Left Center Right Just middle mpg cyl disp hp drat wt qsec vs gear carb 21.0 6 160.0 110 3.90 2.620 16.46 0 1 4 4 21.0 6 160.0 110 3.90 2.875 17.02 0 1 4 4 22.8 4 108.0 93 3.85 2.320 18.61 1 1 4 1 21.4 6 258.0 110 3.08 3.215 19.44 1 0 3 1 18.7 8 360.0 175 3.15 3.440 17.02 0 0 3 2 18.1 6 225.0 105 2.76 3.460 20.22 1 0 3 1 14.3 8 360.0 245 3.21 3.570 15.84 0 0 3 4 24.4 4 146.7 62 3.69 3.190 20.00 1 0 4 2 22.8 4 140.8 95 3.92 3.150 22.90 1 0 4 2 19.2 6 167.6 123 3.92 3.440 18.30 1 0 4 4 17.8 6 167.6 123 3.92 3.440 18.90 1 0 4 4 16.4 8 275.8 180 3.07 4.070 17.40 0 0 3 3 17.3 8 275.8 180 3.07 3.730 17.60 0 0 3 3 15.2 8 275.8 180 3.07 3.780 18.00 0 0 3 3 10.4 8 472.0 205 2.93 5.250 17.98 0 0 3 4 footnote. 19:17 Wednesday, March 05, 2025 ’ve added titles footnotes document. functions clin_add_titles() clin_add_footnotes() allow insert titles footnotes clintable metadata. clintable written document printed, titles respected. ’re printing interactively, HTML ’s rendered allows see titles footnotes table ’re viewing individual page. writing docx file, titles placed header footnotes placed footer. example, providing list character vectors, element list added new line. broad assumptions made: titles, single element align center. footnotes, element align right. two elements provided, align left right. three elements provided, align left, right, center. Ultimately, attached tables converted flextables. , can create flextable attach header footer using ft option clin_add_titles(). also helper function new_title_footnote() allows supply list generate flextable can apply extra formatting desired.
code: ct <- clintable(mtcars) |>   clin_add_titles(     list(       c("Left", "Center", "Right"),       c("Just the middle")     )   ) |>    clin_add_footnotes(       list(         c(           "Here's a footnote.",            format(Sys.time(), "%H:%M %A, %B %d, %Y")         )       )     )  print(ct)

title: Getting Started
text: Let’s look couple functions. Left Center Right Just middle a1 mpg cyl hp disp drat wt 21.0 6 110 160.0 3.90 2.620 21.0 6 110 160.0 3.90 2.875 22.8 4 93 108.0 3.85 2.320 21.4 6 110 258.0 3.08 3.215 18.7 8 175 360.0 3.15 3.440 18.1 6 105 225.0 2.76 3.460 14.3 8 245 360.0 3.21 3.570 24.4 4 62 146.7 3.69 3.190 22.8 4 95 140.8 3.92 3.150 19.2 6 123 167.6 3.92 3.440 footnote. 19:17 Wednesday, March 05, 2025 Left Center Right Just middle a1 mpg cyl hp qsec vs 21.0 6 110 16.46 0 1 21.0 6 110 17.02 0 1 22.8 4 93 18.61 1 1 21.4 6 110 19.44 1 0 18.7 8 175 17.02 0 0 18.1 6 105 20.22 1 0 14.3 8 245 15.84 0 0 24.4 4 62 20.00 1 0 22.8 4 95 22.90 1 0 19.2 6 123 18.30 1 0 footnote. 19:17 Wednesday, March 05, 2025 Left Center Right Just middle a1 mpg cyl hp gear carb 21.0 6 110 4 4 21.0 6 110 4 4 22.8 4 93 4 1 21.4 6 110 3 1 18.7 8 175 3 2 18.1 6 105 3 1 14.3 8 245 3 4 24.4 4 62 4 2 22.8 4 95 4 2 19.2 6 123 4 4 footnote. 19:17 Wednesday, March 05, 2025 number new things happened . Let’s go function function. First, ’ve used function clin_page_by() manually specify page breaks handled. data driven function, ’ve specified use page variable dat2 dataframe. time variable changes, page break inserted. Note isn’t used sorting, just inserting change break. Next, ’ve used function clin_group_by(). allows us put lines column headers using data input data frame. Similar clin_page_by() time value changes, new page start. Just like table data, lines column headers always reflect data within variable. can use many group variable need . Next ’ve used clin_alt_pages(). one requested features ’ve seen since originally developed package {pharmaRTF}. feature designed handle cases number variables need present overflow width page available. function works rotating pages, data rows presented overflowing page, necessary, columns presented change. first input clintable object, two parameters: key_cols: Columns fixed page presented col_groups: groups columns presented alternating pages look function specifically: total 3 alternating pages. columns presented page : mpg, cyl, hp, disp, drat, wt mpg, cyl, hp, qsec, vs, mpg, cyl, hp, gear, carb make things easier developer, developing interactively print method updated print 3 pages styled HTML viewer pane, can select page choice page selector table. printing word document, pages inserted proper order. logic works follows: Identify chunk rows given page. can based page_by method manually insert page breaks can select maximum rows print single page Identify separate columns necessary individual pages Write chunk rows set col_groups order jumping next set rows.
code: dat <- mtcars dat['page'] <- c(   rep(1, 10),   rep(2, 10),   rep(3, 10),   c(4, 4) ) dat2 <- rbind(dat, dat) dat2['groups1'] <- c(   rep('a', 32),   rep('b', 32) ) dat2['groups2'] <- c(   rep('1', 16),   rep('2', 16),   rep('1', 16),   rep('2', 16) )  # Create a basic table ct <- clintable(dat2) |>    clin_page_by('page') |>    clin_group_by(c('groups1', 'groups2')) |>    clin_alt_pages(     key_cols = c('mpg', 'cyl', 'hp'),     col_groups = list(       c('disp', 'drat', 'wt'),       c('qsec', 'vs', 'am'),       c('gear', 'carb')     )    ) |>    clin_col_widths(mpg = .2, cyl=.2, disp=.15, vs=.15) |>   clin_add_titles(     list(       c("Left", "Center", "Right"),       c("Just the middle")     )   ) |>    clin_add_footnotes(       list(         c(           "Here's a footnote.",            format(Sys.time(), "%H:%M %A, %B %d, %Y")         )       )     )  print(ct) [...] |>   clin_alt_pages(     key_cols = c('mpg', 'cyl', 'hp'),     col_groups = list(       c('disp', 'drat', 'wt'),       c('qsec', 'vs', 'am'),       c('gear', 'carb')     )    )

title: Getting Started
text: previous example, another {clinify} function used clin_col_width(). goal function simply make setting column widths table straightforward. default, {flextable} column widths based unit inches centimeters. clin_col_width() allow use proportion page ’d like column fill. syntax : case, ’re saying : mpg fill 20% page cyl fill 20% page disp fill 15% page vs fill 15% page rest columns spaced evenly based remaining space. space ’s filled based default configurations page width, configurable within session. Furthermore, clin_col_width() adapts alternating pages. ratios given key columns apply alternating page, proportions applied additional col_group variables adapt remaining space ensure page fits total page width. One last tedious part structuring table getting table headers formatted correctly. couple specific features, spanning headers, can also tricky get right, especially semi-automated way. reason, ’ve added function clin_column_headers() make process bit easier. Let’s use iris example table want apply spanning headers. Flowers    Sepal Petal Length Width Length Width 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.0 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.7 3.2 1.3 0.2 setosa 4.6 3.1 1.5 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.6 1.4 0.2 setosa 5.4 3.9 1.7 0.4 setosa 4.6 3.4 1.4 0.3 setosa 5.0 3.4 1.5 0.2 setosa 4.4 2.9 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.1 1.5 0.1 setosa 5.4 3.7 1.5 0.2 setosa 4.8 3.4 1.6 0.2 setosa 4.8 3.0 1.4 0.1 setosa 4.3 3.0 1.1 0.1 setosa 5.8 4.0 1.2 0.2 setosa first parameter clin_column_headers() clintable object want headers apply. , use column name ’re applying header. way function works use character element row headers want apply. example, need three rows headers, can use 3 elements single column. elements go respective rows. using spanning headers, ’re also typically using cell merging single string text spans multiple columns. accomplish , repeat text want merge ensure elements placed row. Consider example : Sepal variable, two spanning headers. One “flowers”, one “Sepal”. cells merged, bottom row contains “Length” “Width” separately. Another common way may want apply headers using variable labels. default, clintable respect . Furthermore, spanning can achieved well. Let’s consider another example: Flower  Sepal Petal Length Width Length Width 5.1 3.5 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.0 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.7 3.2 1.3 0.2 setosa 4.6 3.1 1.5 0.2 setosa 5.0 3.6 1.4 0.2 setosa 5.4 3.9 1.7 0.4 setosa 4.6 3.4 1.4 0.3 setosa 5.0 3.4 1.5 0.2 setosa 4.4 2.9 1.4 0.2 setosa 4.9 3.1 1.5 0.1 setosa 5.4 3.7 1.5 0.2 setosa 4.8 3.4 1.6 0.2 setosa 4.8 3.0 1.4 0.1 setosa 4.3 3.0 1.1 0.1 setosa 5.8 4.0 1.2 0.2 setosa underlying logic example exactly using clin_column_headers(), fact clin_column_headers() actually called default. difference , separate levels use delimiter ||. Note example spanning variable also changed Flower stretches four Petal Sepal columns. Note headers applied, additional styling can done. case, use flextable::align() function change alignment table body column headers center. Note default styles applied table written printed, might potentially override settings depending functions applied.
code: [...] |>   clin_col_widths(mpg = .2, cyl=.2, disp=.15, vs=.15) |> [...] clintable(iris) |>      clin_column_headers(       Sepal.Length = c("Flowers", "Sepal", "Length"),         Sepal.Width = c("Flowers", "Sepal", "Width"),         Petal.Length = c("Petal", "Length"),         Petal.Width = c("Petal", "Width")     ) [...]       Sepal.Length = c("Flowers", "Sepal", "Length"),         Sepal.Width = c("Flowers", "Sepal", "Width"),   [...] iris2 <- iris   attr(iris2$Sepal.Length, 'label') <- "Flower||Sepal||Length"   attr(iris2$Sepal.Width, 'label') <- "Flower||Sepal||Width"   attr(iris2$Petal.Length, 'label') <- "Flower||Petal||Length"   attr(iris2$Petal.Width, 'label') <- "Flower||Petal||Width"    clintable(iris2) |>      align(align='center', part='header') |>     align(align='center', part='body')

title: Getting Started
text: printing table development helps development process, ultimately {clinify} lets write document docx file. primary reason wanted build top {flextable}; {flextable} {officer} ’re able great amount control things written specifically written word document. try make process rather seamless comparable print() method. write document docx, use write_clintable() function. Let’s revisit table .
code: # Create a basic table ct <- clintable(dat2) |>    clin_page_by(max_rows = 36) |>    clin_group_by(c('groups1', 'groups2')) |>    clin_alt_pages(     key_cols = c('mpg', 'cyl', 'hp'),     col_groups = list(       c('disp', 'drat', 'wt'),       c('qsec', 'vs', 'am'),       c('gear', 'carb')     )    ) |>    clin_col_widths(mpg = .2, cyl=.2, disp=.15, vs=.15) |>   clin_add_titles(     list(       c("Left", "Center", "Right"),       c("Just the middle")     )   ) |>    clin_add_footnotes(       list(         c(           "Here's a footnote.",            format(Sys.time(), "%H:%M %A, %B %d, %Y")         )       )     )  write_clintable(ct, file="example_table.docx")

title: Getting Started
text: {clinify}? explained earlier, key idea {flextable} {officer} much functionality ’s already needed - {clinify} focuses specific additional features streamline certain pieces make development tables straightforward. One last point building package, also didn’t want reinvent wheel. Several packages coordinate {flextable} {officer} ecosystem, {rtables} {gtsummary}. intent {clinify} can hopefully work packages well introduce tedious additional functionality.

what: flextable and officer extensions for clinical outputs
title: flextable and officer extensions for clinical outputs
text: {clinify} direct extension {flextable} {officer} packages, aimed supplementing functionality simplifying common tasks creation clinical tables, listings figures.

title: flextable and officer extensions for clinical outputs
text: can install development version {clinify} like :

title: flextable and officer extensions for clinical outputs
text: ’s large assortment table packages available, many specifically catered clinical reporting. many organizations, one packages may well great choice, couple key motivators ’ve found lead drove us start writing {clinify}: Clinical output standards likely exist within organization, changing standards may option ’s likely certain outputs require deviate standards, flexibility necessary, sometimes highly nuanced ways Organizations like Contract Research Organizations (CROs) may adapt multiple clients’ reporting standards, likely don’t look Regardless situation, reuse repeatability given configuration critical, changes configuration must easily implemented. Instead building new package ground , {clinify} aims extend see best choice situation hand, adding new functionality necessary streamlining common tasks make efficient programmers implement. chose {flextable} two key reasons: {flextable} already offers functionality ’re looking , particularly pairing {officer}. example, word documents first class priority output support. creating table focus, output tends just table. need capability modify underlying document whole, another place {officer} truly necessary.

title: flextable and officer extensions for clinical outputs
text: key principles ’re using building {clinify}: {clinify} objects inherit underlying {flextable} {officer} object {clinify} functionality must interfere {flextable} {officer} functionality, .e. {flextable} {officer} functions called operate without error.

title: flextable and officer extensions for clinical outputs
text: ’s basic example clinify’s benefit action  Built {flextable} {officer}, can write table docx file.
code: library(clinify) # Mock some data dat <- mtcars dat['page'] <- c(   rep(1, 10),   rep(2, 10),   rep(3, 10),   c(4, 4) ) dat2 <- rbind(dat, dat) dat2['groups'] <- c(   rep('a', 32),   rep('b', 32) )  # Create a basic table ct <- clintable(dat2) |>    # Break pages by the "page" variable   clin_page_by('page') |>    # Add header lines using the "groups" variable   clin_group_by('groups') |>    # For overflowing columns, alternate pages with    # fixed variables for each page   clin_alt_pages(     key_cols = c('mpg', 'cyl', 'hp'),     col_groups = list(       c('disp', 'drat', 'wt'),       c('qsec', 'vs', 'am'),       c('gear', 'carb')     )    ) |>    # Apply column widths as a proportion of the total page   # For alternating pages, the proportion allocated to key columns   # is carried to each page group   clin_col_widths(mpg = .2, cyl=.2, disp=.15, vs=.15) |>   # Add titles here is using new_header_footer to allow flextable functions   # to customize the titles block   clin_add_titles(     list(       c("Left", "Center", "Right"),       c("Just the middle")     )   ) |>    clin_add_footnotes(       list(         c(           "Here's a footnote.",            format(Sys.time(), "%H:%M %A, %B %d, %Y")         )       )     )    # Print pages (by default 3 pages) to the viewer of the IDE print(ct) # Write the table out to docx write_clintable(ct, "demo_table.docx")

title: Add page footer — clin_add_titles
text: function adds text, passed argument, .docx bottom colontitle (page footer). result, text repeated page document. Takes list lists input parameter, sublist represents separate line (row) text. also possibility add row left- right-aligned text. - simply pass two items sublist instead one.

title: Add page footer — clin_add_titles
code: clin_add_titles(x, ls = NULL, ft = NULL)  clin_add_footnotes(x, ls = NULL, ft = NULL)

title: Add page footer — clin_add_titles
text: x clintable object ls list character vectors, 3 elements vector ft flextable object use header

title: Add page footer — clin_add_titles
text: clintable object

title: Add page footer — clin_add_titles
code: add_page_footer(c(c("left aligned", "centered", "right aligned"),                   c("left aligned", "right aligned"))) #> Error in add_page_footer(c(c("left aligned", "centered", "right aligned"),     c("left aligned", "right aligned"))): could not find function "add_page_footer" add_page_footer(NA) #> Error in add_page_footer(NA): could not find function "add_page_footer" add_page_footer(c(c("right aligned"))) #> Error in add_page_footer(c(c("right aligned"))): could not find function "add_page_footer"

what: Set the column headers of the output clintable — clin_column_headers
title: Set the column headers of the output clintable — clin_column_headers
text: function allows apply column headers named arguments character vectors. Separate elements character vector converted separate levels output table header. headers applied goes top bottom, provide 3 elements column header, first element applied top second bottom. one variable three levels variable one two, columns less levels header bind bottom. column two levels apply second third row, column one level apply bottom row. Spanners determined using cells text value, horizontal vertical merging performed.

title: Set the column headers of the output clintable — clin_column_headers

title: The function to apply default footnote styling — clinify_footnotes_default
